alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 8:42PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worcester and northeastern Franklin Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hinsdale, or near Brattleboro, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage from wind-driven small hail is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Orange, Athol, Montague, Northfield, Bernardston, Leverett, Erving, Shutesbury, Phillipston, Gill, Royalston, Petersham, New Salem, Wendell, Warwick and Leyden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
